definition: to charge/to pounce on/to swoop down on
to throw oneself at/to pounce on/to devote one's energies/to flap/to flutter/to dab/to pat/to bend over

sentences.english: The panther pounced on the little rabbit, but muxxed it.
sentences.chinese: 黑豹朝小免子猛扑去，不过没扑着。

sentences.english: The security fuard launched himself and took him down to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 这位保全向那个抢匪猛扑过去，把他压倒在地上。

sentences.english: The man hurled his spear at one bear , and the dogs hurled themselves at the other.
sentences.chinese: 那人将矛猛朝一只熊投去，众犬也猛扑另一只熊。

sentences.english: The cat crept up on the bird and pounced .
sentences.chinese: 那只猫悄悄地爬近那只鸟，接着便猛扑过去。

sentences.english: A dozen hands swooped down and snatched the pieces of meat.
sentences.chinese: 十多只手猛扑下来抢抓肉块。

sentences.english: The policeman pounced on the thief.
Twice he had seen leopards pouncing on unsuspecting young baboons.
sentences.chinese: 他两次目睹群豹向毫无戒备的小狒狒猛扑过去。

sentences.english: The cat pounced on the bird.
A duck flies off in alarm as an osprey swoops in to catch its lunch.
sentences.chinese: 鱼鹰猛扑到池塘抓鱼作午餐的时候惊起了一只鸭子。

sentences.english: The boxer tore into his opponent and floored him.
sentences.chinese: 拳击手朝对手猛扑过去并将他打倒在地。

sentences.english: The wind were swooping down to tease the waves.
sentences.chinese: 大风猛扑到海面上戏弄着浪涛。

sentences.english: The panther pounced on the little rabbit,but missed it.
sentences.chinese: 黑豹朝小兔子猛扑过去，不过没扑着。

sentences.english: A cat pounces on a mouse.
sentences.chinese: 猫会猛扑过去抓住老鼠。

sentences.english: The lion bounded on the prey.
sentences.chinese: 那头狮子向猎物猛扑过去。

sentences.english: David yelled out, ‘It’s an earthquake,’ and we both lunged and everything turned dark.
sentences.chinese: 大卫喊‘地震了’，我俩一个猛扑，一下全黑了。

sentences.english: They swam past my face, swooping down from the black sky.
sentences.chinese: 他们从我面前游过，从黑色的天空猛扑过去。

definition: to throw oneself at/to pounce on/to devote one's energies/to flap/to flutter/to dab/to pat/to bend over
to jump up suddenly/to bound up/to rise up in one bound
(idiom) no sooner said than done/before you know it
pinyin: shuo1 shi2 chi2 , na4 shi2 kuai4

definition: to flee/to scuttle/to exile or banish/to amend or edit
like a hungry tiger pouncing on its prey
to bare fangs and brandish claws (idiom); to make threatening gestures
with all one's might/with sudden force/violently/to slam
to make a surprise attack/to pounce on (an enemy)
